claims: Quasars are believed to gain energy from matter attracted by a large black hole.

claims: Quasars are believed to gain energy from matter attracted by a large black hole.

Quasars are believed to gain energy from: How do quasars gain energy? Quasars energy source black hole

Light and other radiation cannot escape from within the event horizon of a black hole. The energy produced by a quasar is generated outside the black hole, by gravitational stresses and immense friction within the material nearest to the black hole, as it orbits and falls inward.
How do quasars gain energy? Quasars energy source black hole

Quasars are powered by giant black holes of up to ten billion (1010) times the mass of the sun. Their enormous luminosities are the result of frictional forces acting upon matter as it spirals toward the black hole, heating the gas until it glows.
